content.description: From the sit start explode with power to hit the jug. Either finish directly or work slightly left in order to make the problem contrived and more powerful (v5)
content.protection: 1 pad. This is a great low ball, but the landings on the hill give opportunity for pads to be kicked out and three stooges type of action to follow.
content.location: This is located just climbers right and lower of Slight Dab. Sit start on side of steep hill (awkward)

content.description: Start left up jugs and good crimp. Move right at 2nd horizontal crack and using crimp work over to the vertical crack and follow it up to decent top out. The way the slab bulbs outward makes it a bit awkward but fun.
content.protection: Pad and spotters would be nice
content.location: Far right of Lisa's Slabs. Look for the Porcelain representation of Baby Jesus at start.

content.description: This is a short crack that gets a little creepy at the top because it starts at about 8 feet up.  Sit start the crack and work into a trusty layback with foot jams to top out.
content.protection: Padding and spotting are difficult. If it goes wrong at the top, there is potential for much calamity/hilarity.
content.location: This is only about 15ft right of Squat Thrust. The climb starts on the "next level up".

content.description: This route can go a few ways. Go straight up the crack system. Or traverse further left past the drop off and work up the lay back crack.    Another option would be to continue the traverse all the way until the cliff line ends
content.protection: pads and good spotters are recommended. Though the heights are low, the landing has a cliff behind it.
content.location: Park at the lot of Observation Park. this is at 10th Ave W and 3rd St. The rock is located directly below the old hockey rink.   Sit start on the low flake

content.description: The slabs have a few challenging lines with ankle-twisting landings.  There are also more climbs to the left and far right of this slab.  Easier shorter stuff can be found below Observation Park, just over the hill and to the right.
